intro: Pouzolzia pentandra subsp. wightii, commonly known as the Indian gooseberry or amla, is a shrub native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that turn from green to orange-red when mature. These berries are rich in vitamin C and are widely used in traditional medicine and culinary practices. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts.
